simplified: Your dreams can show you things you didn’t know you were thinking about. Flying or falling, losing teeth, or being without clothes in public are common dreams. These dreams probably mean similar things for everyone. But to understand what they mean for you, think about what is happening in your life and how you feel.

There are many wild dogs in Moscow. About 35,000 dogs live in the city. Some dogs were born in the wild. Others were pets that people left. Some dogs live by themselves. Others live together in groups. Scientists looked at the dogs in 2010. They saw that the dogs are doing well in the city. They have learned to be careful when crossing the road with people. Some dogs seem to understand traffic lights.

Wonder is a book by RJ Palacio. She wrote it after seeing a girl with a different face. The book is very popular in America and has won prizes. Schools use it to talk about being kind, having friends, and being different. There is a movie coming soon. Many people want to read more books by RJ Palacio.

Chloe has two rats. Their names are Zena and Roxy. Chloe knows that many people don’t like rats. She tries to explain that rats can be good pets if you take care of them. She didn't like rats before, but her friend Martin showed her his rats. She saw that they were friendly and smart. Last year, Martin's rat had babies. Chloe wanted two of the babies.

Baboons can be in danger in Cape Town. Sometimes they get hurt by cars, or they die from electricity. Baboons are rare, so we need to protect them. The city has people called Baboon Monitors. They help keep baboons away from the city. They move them to the countryside. This helps, but baboons sometimes come back because they find food in the city.

I have a job with a big computer company. Their main office is in America, so I work online from my house. I don’t have to travel to work, and I don’t talk much with my coworkers. I do different projects, and this is good because I can take time off when my children need me. For example, I can go to their school shows or see the dentist. The problem is I often work late, sometimes I don't eat dinner to finish my work.

In the 1990s, people still wrote graffiti. But there was also a lot of street art everywhere. Some artists wanted to say things about politics. They made art about war, not being fair, and treating people badly. Other artists wanted to make nice, pretty pictures. In South America, many artists painted in poor areas. They added color and made the city walls look better.

We see many things to buy every day - on social media, in magazines, and in shops. People in Britain buy a lot of clothes and shoes now. It’s easy to buy things online. Big shops sell cheap clothes, so people don’t always take care of them. They wear them a few times and then throw them away.

Sam looked at the car’s path in the dust. It was going to the Big House. The horses moved their tails because of the flies. They didn’t care that their owner was visiting after a long time. Sam waited. Mr. Carter didn’t come here often, and Sam liked that. The less Sam saw of his boss, the safer his job was. Mr. Carter wiped his neck. His shirt was wet. His face was getting red in the sun. He looked like a man who stays inside and makes money while others work.

People in Berlin were upset about hunters shooting pigs. They thought it was not kind. Hunters and people who love animals argued. The city decided to do something different. They built fences and said people could not feed the pigs. It is not clear if this will work. The weather is warmer now, so there are more pigs.

The book Hunger Games has ideas from old Greek stories. Suzanne Collins, the writer, liked stories from when she was a child. One story she liked was about Theseus and the Minotaur. In this story, Athens was ruled by Crete. Athens fought back. As a punishment, the king of Crete made Athens send boys and girls to Crete each year. They went into a maze and a monster called the Minotaur ate them. But Theseus fought the Minotaur and killed it. Suzanne thinks Katniss is like a modern Theseus.

Zoos can help people learn about nature and animals. They can show us why it’s important to protect them and where they live. Some zoos give a safe home to animals that were hurt or left alone. Zoos also study animals to help them stay healthy.

Some people don’t want to buy a lot of things. They have a new idea: ‘buy nothing’. It started in Canada a long time ago. Then, people in the USA started doing it too. They didn't want to spend too much money on Black Friday and Cyber Monday. On Buy Nothing Day, people protest and cut up their credit cards. All year, people share and fix things they already have.

Is graffiti art or vandalism? It depends on what you think. In many places, writing or painting on buildings that belong to people or the government is vandalism. Sometimes, street artists are stopped by the police and they have to pay money. City governments often say it costs a lot of money to clean graffiti from buildings and buses.

Some people think graffiti and street art are art. Now, more people see its value. There have been big shows of street art in Paris, London and Los Angeles. An artist called Elura Emerald showed street art in New York in 2008. She said street artists are expressing themselves and should be celebrated.

After you are ten years old, you dream four or six times every night. That is many dreams each year – maybe 2,000! If you live to be 80 years old, you might have 140,000 dreams. You forget most dreams – about 95 to 99 percent. But you will still remember some dreams. Sometimes, a dream is like something that happens in real life. This is normal, especially if the dream is about things you do often.

The story 'The Hunger Games' is set in the future. North America is destroyed. The country is called Panem. It has twelve areas that are not rich. They are controlled by a rich city called Capitol. Capitol is very powerful. Each area makes different things for Capitol. Area 12 gives coal. There was another area, number 13, but it fought against Capitol and was destroyed.

Sometimes, wild animals go to cities to find food. In Cape Town, South Africa, baboons are going to homes near the city to eat. They open bins and eat fruit from gardens. Some baboons even go into houses and take food! Baboons can be dangerous and have hurt pets. Many people in the city don't want them there.

Many bridge accidents happen when the bridge is being built. These accidents often happen because engineers make mistakes, like calculating something wrong. The bridge can fall down because of its own weight. This can be very dangerous for the workers.

George Lucas was an early film director. He used the hero's journey in his stories. Usually, the hero is living a normal life. Then, something happens and they must go on an adventure. In Star Wars, Luke is with his aunt and uncle. He fixes robots. He finds a message from Princess Leia. It is in a robot called R2D2. This message asks for help. It is the start of Luke's adventure.

Some people think we can stop a big rock from hitting Earth by using a bomb. It looks like something from a movie, and it was in a movie called Armageddon. NASA has a plan called HAMMER. Big rockets would fly at the rock to push it away. If the rock is too close, the rockets will have bombs to break it into pieces.

Campbell says the hero doesn’t want to start the adventure at first. But then, someone helps them. This person is a mentor. The hero then goes into a new place where the adventure happens. Next, the hero has tests and fights bad people. They also meet friends. This helps them get ready for a big problem. In Luke’s story, Obi-Wan is the mentor. Han Solo and the robots R2D2 and C3PO are his friends. Darth Vader is the enemy in the Death Star.

Some things are not used much. Some people may think they are not useful, but others might find them helpful. Because of the internet, people can share these things and make money. Websites and social media help people buy and sell used items. It is now easy for people to share things with each other. This is called the sharing economy.

People started to have different ideas about dreams a long time ago. Some thought dreams showed hidden feelings. Freud said if we understand our dreams, we can understand our secret feelings and problems. Others thought dreams were just random things happening in our brain when we remember things from the day. When we wake up, we try to make sense of these pictures and feelings and put them into a story.

I work for myself. I like this because I can choose what I do. At first, I worked at home. But it was difficult to focus. There were many things to distract me, like cleaning and family. Then, I went to a café. The internet was not good, and I drank too much coffee. Now, I rent a desk with other people who work like me. I like getting ready for work and working in an office.

NASA wants to find smaller asteroids. They need money to build a special telescope called NEOCam. This telescope uses light to find asteroids. If they get the money, they can probably finish the job in ten years. After that, the team will need to find ways to protect the Earth from the most dangerous asteroids.

Some people are not buying things now. They share this idea on social media. Usually, these people show things they like and want others to buy. Now, some YouTubers say, 'Don’t buy anything!' Some people in Canada didn't buy anything except food for one year. At first, they didn't buy things like electronics, clothes, or things for their homes. Then, they stopped using some services, like getting haircuts or eating at restaurants. They also didn't buy gas for their cars. After one year, they saved a lot of money – $55,000.

Pi likes religion. His family is Hindu, but he wants to learn about other religions. He becomes friends with a Christian priest and a Muslim baker. Pi says he is Hindu, Muslim, and Christian at the same time. His family and teachers ask him to choose one, but he doesn’t want to. He says he just wants to love God. Then, they let him decide for himself.

Some people believe writing about your dreams can help you have dreams where you know you are dreaming. In these dreams, you can control what happens. You can change a bad dream into a good one, or make the dream go in the way you want. This is like being a film director. You will not only understand your dreams, but you will also make them. But it’s still good to have dreams where you can learn about what you are thinking!

Some people give old clothes to charities. But charities cannot sell all of these clothes. Clothes go out of fashion quickly. They are often not good quality, so they cannot be recycled. People do not want to buy used clothes. Many clothes are thrown away. Charities also send clothes to other countries. This can cause problems for those countries.

Some people like to have many adventures. Meagan McGrath is from Canada. She has climbed very tall mountains in different parts of the world. She has also cycled across Canada and run a race in the hot Sahara Desert. One amazing trip was skiing to the South Pole. The first day, she fell into ice and needed help. Most people would have stopped. But Meagan kept going. She reached the South Pole after forty days. She pulled a sled with her tent and food behind her. It was very cold and there were big snow storms.
Blek le Rat started painting rats in Paris. Now, he wants people to think about problems in society. He paints pictures of people who don't have homes. He wants people to think about this problem.

Some cities want artists to paint in special places. For example, in Taiwan, there are areas where artists can paint on walls. In Brazil, some artists can paint on trains. This helps artists and keeps cities cleaner.

Faith47 lives in Cape Town, South Africa. She paints big, bright pictures of people and animals. She likes to go to new places. You can see her art on streets, in old buildings, and on old cars. She likes that street art doesn't last forever. Sometimes the weather or the city cleans it away. She thinks this shows that life changes, with things ending and new things starting.

Gabriela used to work in a place where people respected authority. Leaders made decisions, and people didn't question them. Now, her team is from Sweden. In Sweden, people often work together with their leaders to solve problems. Leaders help and teach, and people can share their ideas.

Gabriela noticed that her team was different from her. She talked to them about how they felt about her being their leader. The team was happy she asked. They said they were not used to being told exactly what to do. They liked to make their own ideas and decisions. When Gabriela told them what to do, they felt she didn't trust them. They understood that Gabriela felt upset when they suggested changes. They said this was how they always worked.
Os Gêmeos are twin brothers from Brazil. They paint pictures on walls. Sometimes the pictures are very big, so they use machines to help them. In 2007, they painted a castle in Scotland.

People have always written and painted on walls. A long time ago, in Africa and Europe, people painted animals and people on cave walls. We can find old drawings on buildings in Greece, Italy, Syria and Iraq. In Pompeii, a Roman town, people wrote messages on walls. These messages were about religion, politics, love, and even magic!

Have you ever wanted to climb a tall mountain like Mount Everest, or walk to the South Pole? Many people do this every year. They climb high mountains or walk far across the world. Explorers used to use maps. Now, people use new technology like GPS. Some adventurers love nature and want to help the world. Others want to help people and give money to charities.

There is a plan called DART. It will test something on the moon of an asteroid called Didymos. Didymoon is about 150 metres wide. It goes around a bigger asteroid called Didymos, which is 800 metres wide. The plan is that DART will push Didymoon a little bit. Then, telescopes on Earth will be able to see the change.

The story is about a girl named Katniss. She is sixteen years old. Her father died in an accident, so she needs to find food for her family. She hunts in the forest with her friend, Gale. She is good at using a bow and arrow. One day, her sister, Prim, is chosen for a special event. Katniss decides to go in her place. Another boy, Peeta, is also going. Katniss and Peeta start to have a difficult relationship.

Writing about your dreams can help you remember more. Think about the people and places in your dream. They might be important. You will be surprised how much you write in one week. Then, you can see how your dreams are connected to your life.
In the past, many bridges were made of wood. Wood is easy to burn, so these bridges often caught fire. This was a problem with bridges for trains, because sparks from the train could start a fire.

We don’t know what will happen with street art. But we can see some changes. Most street artists are young and paint in their town. Now, many artists travel and work in different countries. They also use the internet to talk and share photos. The art world is starting to see street art as real art. Street art is changing, but it will stay with us!

Suzanne felt sad when she watched news about wars. Her father was a pilot in the US Air Force and fought in Vietnam when she was a child. Her mother didn’t tell her much about the war, but Suzanne still saw the news. She knew her father was fighting. It was scary for her.

PricewaterhouseCoopers (PwC) asked many people about work. More than 40,000 people answered questions about their workplace. They talked about how they work and how much they earn. Deloitte also asked more than 10,000 young people about work. They wanted to know what they think about the problems and chances in the world of work.

Erik Weihenmayer is from the United States. He likes adventures. He rode a bike in the desert. He went kayaking in the Grand Canyon. He climbed Mount Everest. Erik could not see when he was 13 years old. He wants people with disabilities to be active. He takes young blind people on trips to climb mountains.

Now, it’s easier to make a little money online. For example, before, some parents didn’t have time to sell their children’s old things at a market. But now, with online shops, they can sell baby clothes and equipment that their children don't use anymore. This helps them earn some extra money.

Pi and a tiger named Richard Parker are in a small boat for many days. They are very hungry and tired. They get sick sometimes. There are big storms and the sun is very hot. But they live! Sometimes Pi feels better when he thinks about his religion. But sometimes he feels very sad and alone. Finally, they see land – Mexico! Then, things change. You need to read the book to know what happens next to Pi and Richard Parker.

Chloe came home from school. She made coffee and took it to her room. She had homework, but she could do it later. She wanted to be quiet for a little while before her parents came home. Then the house would be noisy. She likes this time because she can play with her pet rats.

In 2010, NASA found most of the big rocks near Earth. These rocks are called NEOs. They are very big, like mountains. NASA knows about 887 of these rocks. They say these rocks are not dangerous for Earth.

Auggie decides to go to school. His first day is difficult. He feels nervous, like many children starting a new school. But people look at him because he looks different. Nobody wants to sit with him. He sees kids looking and talking about him. He meets Jack, a boy in his class, and Summer, a girl he talks to at lunchtime. It's not easy just on the first day. Other students are scared to touch him because they think he is sick. During the school year, Auggie has many good and bad moments. Then, something bad happens at a school trip, and everything changes.

The two men looked north. The land went on and on. They could not see the fences. A boy might want to leave, but it was hard to walk away. Sam looked at a big horse. It moved its feet on the ground. Could the boy ride the horse? It could be dangerous to ride far away from people. But it could also be dangerous for a boy who doesn’t know about horses and wants to leave his father.

More than 4,000 people have climbed to the top of Everest. They are between 13 and 80 years old. Climbing high mountains is very dangerous, but good climbers want new things to do. Gerlinde Kaltenbrunner from Austria liked climbing when she was young. After school, she worked in a hospital, but she still climbed mountains when she had time.

Gerlinde climbed Mount Everest. After this, she wanted to climb fourteen very tall mountains. She climbs these mountains without using oxygen. This is dangerous because there is not much oxygen at the top of tall mountains. This can make it hard for her brain and body to work well. Gerlinde uses her fame to help a charity for children and orphans in Nepal.

Look at the things we bought. Sometimes, we don't use them. For example, a warm coat when you live in a hot country. Or a phone we don't use anymore because we bought a new one. Maybe a car we only use on weekends. Or a spare room that is now full of things.

People have always thought dreams could tell the future. They believed dreams were messages from gods, giving important information. Many people remember dreaming about something, and then it happened later.

Some big building projects are bridges. Bridges help cars, trucks, and trains go across water or mountains. They are very important for building and people check them carefully, especially if they break.

Gabriela was sad because of problems with her team. She wrote to her manager. The manager asked if her team was working well and what she needed to work better with them. Gabriela didn't think the manager was helping.

Dogs that live together have learned that people often give food to small, cute dogs. So, these dogs ask for food for the whole group. Some dogs even use the train to travel around their area! Scientists don’t know exactly how the dogs know when to get off the train. Maybe they use their good sense of smell to find places they like. Or maybe they listen to the station names. People on the trains are used to seeing dogs now. The dogs travel without people noticing them much.

Ed Stafford is from the UK. He was the first person to walk along the Amazon River. He started in the mountains of Peru. He finished at the river in Brazil. It took him two years and four months. He walked 6,000 kilometers. The rainforest has dangerous animals like snakes, crocodiles, and jaguars. Ed was often in danger. He was bitten by many mosquitoes and ants, but he was okay.

In the UK, people spend a lot of money on clothes. They spend over £1,000 each year. This is about 4% of their money. This might not seem like much, but it is a problem. Many people use credit cards to buy clothes. People in the UK owe a lot of money to credit card companies. Also, people buy things they don't really need. The UK throws away a lot of clothes each year. Most of it goes to big holes in the ground.

Ed could not walk without help from technology. He used a radio to ask people in the rainforest for food and to be allowed to walk across their land. Many people came to see him and helped him find the way through the hard places. While he walked, Ed wrote about his days on a blog. He used the news about his trip to say he was against cutting down the rainforest and to collect money for groups that help the environment and children in Brazil and Peru.

Many businesses see that sharing things can make money. They want to use things that are not being used much. Some companies make websites that connect people who need something with people who can provide it. For example, Airbnb helps people rent out rooms they don’t use. Uber lets people use their cars to drive other people and earn money.

Zoos help animals that are in danger. Some rare animals have trouble finding a mate and having babies in their natural homes. They might also be in danger from people who hunt them, or because their homes are disappearing. Zoos give these animals a safe place to live and have babies. Sometimes, animals in the wild become too similar. Zoos help with this. They breed animals and then let them go back into the wild to make the animal population more different and healthy.

Accidents with bridges are very uncommon. Trains and boats can damage bridges, but for different reasons. Trains can break a bridge because they move very fast. Boats can break a bridge because they are very big, even if they move slowly. We can help stop bridge damage by planning. New technology, safe work, and good designs can all help prevent these accidents.

Pi was scared of the animals, so he jumped into the water. Then he remembered there were sharks. He had to go back to the boat. The animals in the boat started to hurt each other and eat each other. Soon, only Pi and a tiger were left. Pi called the tiger Richard Parker. Richard Parker felt sick and didn't want to eat Pi.

Pi is 16 years old. A new government comes to power, and Pi’s parents are not happy. They worry about the future. So, they decide to close the zoo and move to Canada. They sell some animals to other zoos. The family travels to Canada on a ship with the animals. During the journey, there is a big storm. The ship sinks. Sadly, Pi’s family and the sailors die. But Pi is safe in a small boat. He is with a hyena, a zebra, a monkey, and a big tiger.

The Hunger Games is a popular book for young people. Suzanne Collins wrote it in America. It came out in 2008. Many people read it in different countries. It is very popular as a movie too. The movie made a lot of money.

Sometimes we dream. Maybe dreams are when our brain puts our thoughts together. These thoughts have a special meaning in our dreams. When we are awake, we think in words. But when we sleep, our brain doesn't use language as much. Instead, it uses feelings.

It's important to be happy. Happy people often have good friends and family. They spend time with them. It’s good to have one person you can talk to about your feelings. Having friends to do things with is nice, but a closer connection is more important. Sometimes, people need to learn how to listen to others to have better relationships.

Carol Dweck, a psychologist, says our brains can change. We can learn skills even if we weren't good at them before. Often, we say people are good at things because they are born that way, like having a good eye or being good at organizing. But studies show that if we praise people for trying hard, for experimenting, and for solving problems, they can learn new things and get even better.

The rover checks the air around it regularly. In 2014, it found methane in the air. Methane is a simple substance and a part of natural gas. It does not last long – only a few hundred years. This means something on Mars is making more of it. NASA says Mars releases a lot of methane – thousands of tons. The amount of methane changes with the seasons, like the planet is breathing.

A long time ago, Carol Dweck, a psychologist, gave some ten-year-old children problems. The problems were a little difficult. Some children liked the challenge. They thought they could learn and get better. Carol Dweck called this a ‘growth mindset.’ Other children felt they were not very smart. They thought they had failed. They had a ‘fixed mindset.’ They could not imagine getting better. Some of these children said they might cheat. Others looked for children who did worse than them to feel better.

Scary movies often use places where nobody lives. This might be an old, empty hospital, a spooky house, or a town with no people. These places feel lonely. We wonder, what was it like when people lived here? Why did they go? Sometimes, the quietness is scary. It’s also useful for movie makers – it seems more real that you can’t use your phone there.

In scary movies, basements are often frightening. Something bad might be hiding there. Sometimes, a bad person hides things in the basement. Basements are usually dark and wet. You go down a small staircase to get there. Basements feel scary, even if there is nothing there.

Gary Collins was a policeman. He saw the riots on TV. He knew some of the people. He stopped his holiday and helped the police. He watched the videos and found 190 people. He could see their eyes. The police needed his help. It was very important. There was a lot of video – 200,000 hours. A computer program only found one person.

I think it’s interesting to think about how we can change our bodies to become better. Maybe we can put a computer in our brain! It might be possible soon. This could help us with math, seeing and hearing, and remembering things. More and more people will probably think this is a good idea.

The talk was interesting. The speaker was right about some things. For example, parents use phones a lot. How can we tell teenagers not to use phones for homework if we use them while cooking or waiting? She also said people want to be in many places at once. So they talk to people in person and online. I see this with my daughter and her friends. They meet up, but they also talk to others online.

Some news says the world is more violent. But there is also good news. From 1945 to 1990, there were many wars that killed a lot of people. Now, countries are usually more peaceful. But there is more terrorism now. Wars now kill more people who are not soldiers. It is also true that violent crime causes more deaths than wars. The number of murders has gone down a little. In 2000, there were about 8 murders per 100,000 people. In 2015, there were about 5.3.

Wasfia works to help people’s rights. She has seen many projects in Bangladesh that help women and girls. But sometimes, these projects stop, and the women have nothing. Wasfia wanted Bangladesh to help itself. So, she combined her love of climbing mountains with her work on human rights. She wants to change how people think about women in her country. She started climbing when she was helping people in Tibet and Nepal. Most people in Bangladesh have never seen a mountain. Many people in Bangladesh are now paying attention to her work, and people around the world are noticing too.

Many people think that countries with not a lot of money have big problems: they are very poor, have leaders who are not good, and things don't get better. But this is not really true. Things are changing. In the last 20 years, over 700 million people have made more money and are not poor anymore. Also, 6 million fewer children die each year from sickness. Many more girls go to school, and many people have clean water.

Sometimes managers give feedback. They say something good, then something not so good, then something good again. But if they do this often, people might think the good things aren’t real. Good feedback should help people do well, not hide bad news.

I help people stop killer robots. These robots are like machines that can hurt people. Some machines already kill people with little help from humans. Soon, robots might kill people without any humans telling them what to do. This is not right and could be dangerous. We need to be careful about what we ask robots to do.

Many people learn English. More countries use English than other languages. But, more people speak Chinese as their first language. How many people speak a language first doesn’t change how many learn it. But, the more people learn a language, the more countries use it.

Your manager wants to talk to you about the project. You feel worried about it. You think about what you did wrong. On Monday, she says you did a good job. You think she is going to give you feedback. Usually, feedback is nice, then not so nice, then nice again.

This music album is rock music. It is fast and fun to listen to. But the songs also talk about difficult feelings. The songs tell stories about regular people who work hard. They feel sad because they don't have a good life. One song is about people remembering when they were young. Another song is about a man who loses his job. The singer seems to know these people and their lives. The album shows how talented the singer is.

Lewis wants more areas of the sea to be protected. He thinks this can help the sea recover from problems caused by people, like fishing too much, making it dirty, and leaving trash. Lewis has seen these problems himself. He has seen coral that has lost its color because the water is too warm. He has seen places under the sea where there are no fish or plants, and only plastic. Lewis thinks nature can get better if we let it. But we need to act quickly. If we don't take care of the seas, we might have a problem that we can’t fix.

Terrie Sharp is a writer who writes crime stories. She has won an award for her stories. She grew up in a neighborhood with a lot of crime. She learned to be quiet and stay safe. Now, she talks a lot on TV shows and at writing events.

Is life getting worse? Is it hard to make things better? Steven Pinker wrote a book called Enlightenment Now. He looks at how people are doing. He says things are getting better. People are living longer and are healthier. They are freer and happier. Pinker says that reason and science are important. But some people are attacking them. When leaders talk in a way that makes people angry and distrustful, it can hurt important things like democracy and working together around the world.

Old scary movies sometimes showed people in bad situations. They couldn't call for help. Now we have phones, so this is not so believable. To keep the movie scary, there is no phone signal! If you are the main character in a scary movie, your phone won't work when you need it. Or your phone battery will be empty. Or both.

A long time ago, banana companies in Central America had a problem. Their most important banana, called Gros Michel, was dying. Now, the new banana, called Cavendish, is also in trouble. The Gros Michel banana was easy to move and tasted good. It grew a lot in Central America. A company called United Fruit grew a lot of these bananas. They didn't grow them from seeds. They took parts from the banana plants and grew new plants that were the same. This was the easiest way to grow bananas.

Most spiders have venom. They use it to catch food, not to hurt people. Only a few types of spiders have venom that can harm people. Spider bites can hurt, but they are not usually dangerous. The Sydney funnel-web spider in Australia has not killed anyone since 1981, when a medicine was created. Be careful with hairy spiders like tarantulas. If they feel scared, they will release hairs that can irritate your skin or eyes.

Many scary movies from the past used the same idea. It starts with young people having fun. Then, everyone dies except for one girl. This girl is often quiet and not very brave at first. But, at the end, she is very strong and clever. She usually wins.

We want to know how people learned to speak. To understand this, we need to look at our brains. Our brains are different from those of other animals. It’s not just about how big the brain is. It’s also about what the brain can do. We don't have many clues about this. Old things left by our ancestors don’t tell us how they spoke. But we can see how the mouth, throat and tongue changed. About 100,000 years ago, people could make more sounds. Before that, scientists can only guess how early people talked.

Girls are told by people, not by nature, that they should like art and writing more than math and science. Boys are often told to do math and science. It is also difficult to find women who do science jobs. Stories and cartoons often show men as scientists or inventors. Some people think scientists are strange or lonely. These ideas are not true. They can make girls think science is not for them. If girls saw more women doing science, they would feel better about it.

The Scallion comes out once a week. It’s free and people can find it in school buildings. About 10,000 students read it. Students write and make the newspaper. People at the university like it because it's fun, helps them learn about culture, and gives them work experience. It costs a lot of money to print the newspapers. Some students cannot get a copy easily because they have to go to the university to get one. Also, many copies become trash on campus.

At Girox Foods, people leave their jobs about 12 times each year. This is more than other companies, where it's about 7 times a year. This report will look at why employees are not happy at work. We will then suggest ways to make the workplace better and keep employees longer.

Many things the speaker said seemed correct. I think we might feel lonely even when we are connected to many people. My generation is okay because we lived without technology before. We know how to be alone, and it’s good to be alone. But young people under 20 are different. They talk to each other a lot, but they don't feel quiet or alone. They might not learn to like being by themselves. Also, they learn to talk by sending messages. They can change the messages. They don't learn to talk to people in person, right now.

Sometimes, people give good comments and then bad comments. If this happens often, the good comments might not seem important. Try to give good comments sometimes just because they are good. Don't always add something to fix.

Dreams can sometimes show us things we haven't thought about. Common dreams, like flying or falling, or losing your teeth, or feeling embarrassed in public, often have similar meanings for most people. To understand what they mean for you, think about what’s happening in your life and how you feel.

Wild dogs live in Moscow. There are about 35,000 of them living on the streets. Some were born wild, and others were pets that people left behind. Some dogs live alone, and some live together in groups. Scientists studied these dogs in 2010. They found that the dogs have become very good at living in the city. They have learned it’s safer to cross the road with people, and some seem to understand traffic lights.

Wonder is a book by the American writer RJ Palacio. She says she got the idea for the book after seeing a girl with a different appearance in the street. The book has been very popular in the United States and has won many prizes. Many schools use it to talk about problems like bullying, being a good friend, and understanding people who are different. A movie is being made, and many people are excited to see what RJ Palacio writes next.

Chloe has two pet rats called Zena and Roxy. She knows that most people don’t think rats are good pets, and she has often tried to explain that they are clean and can be wonderful pets if you care for them properly. She understands why people might not like rats. Chloe didn't like rats either until her friend Martin showed her his pet rats and she saw how loving and clever they were. Last year, when Martin’s rat had babies, Chloe decided she wanted two of the babies.

Baboons can face danger in Cape Town. Sometimes, they are hurt or die in car accidents, or they get electric shocks when touching wires. Baboons are rare animals, and to protect them and reduce problems with people, the city has a team of Baboon Monitors. These monitors try to move baboons away from towns or catch them and take them to the countryside. This helps, but it’s difficult to stop baboons from returning to the city because they find easy food here.

I have a job with a large company that works in many countries. Their main office is in the United States, so I work online from my home. This is good because I don't have to travel to the office or spend time talking to colleagues. I work on different projects, and I like that I can be flexible. It lets me take time off when my kids have school events or when I need to see a doctor. However, I sometimes work late, even skipping dinner, to finish my jobs.

In the 1990s, graffiti still existed, but there was also a lot more street art happening worldwide. Some artists wanted to share political messages and created art to make people think about problems like war, unfairness, and treating people differently. Other street artists mainly wanted to create pretty and pleasing artwork. In South America, many street artists worked in poor areas, adding colour, happiness, and beauty to dull city walls.

Every day, people see many advertisements for things to buy in places like social media, magazines, and shops. People in Britain are buying more clothes and shoes than before. It’s easy to buy things online without thinking. Big brands sell clothes so cheaply that people often wear them only a few times and then throw them away.

Sam looked at the car’s tracks in the dirt. It was driving towards the Big House. The horses were trying to get rid of flies by moving their tails. They didn't care that it was their owner’s first visit in a long time. Sam waited. Mr. Carter didn't often come to this place, and Sam was happy about that. The less he saw of his boss, the safer his job would be. Mr. Carter wiped the sweat from his neck. His shirt was wet. He looked like a map in the sun. His skin was getting red. He also had a tan from being indoors, while other people worked.

People in Berlin, Germany, had disagreements about shooting pigs. Some people thought it was cruel. To stop the arguments, the city council decided to do things differently. They built fences and made it against the law to give food to the pigs. It’s not clear if this will work, because warmer weather means there are more pigs now than before.

The Hunger Games book was inspired by Greek stories. When Suzanne Collins was a girl, she loved the story of Theseus and the Minotaur. In this story, the city of Athens was controlled by Crete. The people of Athens fought back. As punishment, the king of Crete, Minos, made the Athenians send seven boys and seven girls to Crete each year. These young people were put in a maze and eaten by a monster called the Minotaur. But Theseus fought and killed the Minotaur. Suzanne thinks of Katniss Everdeen as a modern-day Theseus.

Zoos can teach people about protecting animals and their homes. They can also give a safe place for animals that were hurt, or that people could not take care of anymore. Zoos also do research to learn about animals, like how they behave and how to help them when they are sick.

Some people are starting to do the opposite of shopping – they’re not buying anything. This idea began in Canada in the 1990s and then became popular in the United States. It’s a way of saying ‘no’ to spending too much money, especially during Black Friday and Cyber Monday. On Buy Nothing Day, people protest and sometimes even cut up their credit cards. Throughout the year, groups of people share and fix things they already have.

Is graffiti art or vandalism? It depends on what you think. In many countries, writing or painting on buildings that belong to people or the government is seen as vandalism. The police sometimes stop street artists, and they may have to pay money for doing this. City governments often say it costs a lot of money to remove graffiti from buildings and public transport.

Many people in the art world now see graffiti and street art as a valuable form of art. There have been large shows of street art in art galleries in cities like Paris, London and Los Angeles. In 2008, the American artist Elura Emerald showed street art in a New York gallery. She said that street artists are just showing their feelings and not causing harm. She thinks they deserve to be admired and praised.

After the age of ten, most people have four to six dreams each night. This means they could have around 2,000 dreams a year. So, by the time someone is 80 years old, they may have had about 140,000 dreams. Even though people often forget 95 to 99 percent of their dreams, they still remember a few thousand during their lives. It’s easy to imagine that sometimes, a dream will be similar to something that really happens, especially if the dream is about things that happen often.

The Hunger Games is a story set in the future, after North America was destroyed. Now, there is a country called Panem. It has twelve poor areas, called districts. These districts are controlled by the Capitol, which is a rich and powerful place. The Capitol has complete control over the country. Each district makes different goods for the Capitol. District 12, where the story starts, provides coal for everyone. There used to be a thirteenth district, but it fought against the Capitol a long time ago and was destroyed.

Wild animals sometimes go into cities to find food. In Cape Town, South Africa, baboons are now going into areas where people live, near the city. They look for food by opening bins and eating fruit from gardens. Some baboons even go inside houses and take food from the kitchen! Baboons can be dangerous and have hurt pets. Because of this, many people in the city don’t want them there.

Many bridge accidents happen while the bridge is being built. These accidents often happen because engineers make a mistake, like getting a number wrong. The bridge can fall down because it’s too heavy, which can be very dangerous for the workers.

George Lucas was an early film director who used the 17 steps of the hero's journey to tell his stories. Usually, the main character starts in a normal life, but then something happens that leads them to an adventure. In Star Wars, Luke lives a normal life with his aunt and uncle, fixing robots. When he finds Princess Leia's message for Obi-Wan Kenobi in the robot R2D2, this is what starts his adventure.

One idea to stop a large rock from hitting Earth is to destroy it with a bomb. It might seem like a movie story, and it was in the film Armageddon. NASA has a real plan called HAMMER. Large rockets would be fired at the rock to push it off course. If the rock was too close to Earth, the rockets would carry bombs to blow it up.

Campbell says that the hero doesn't want to start the adventure at first. But then, someone appears who helps them and they decide to go on the adventure. They travel to a special place where the adventure happens. Next, the hero faces challenges, fights bad people and makes friends, getting ready for a big test. For Luke, Obi-Wan is the helper, Han Solo and the robots are the friends, and Darth Vader is the enemy in the special place called the Death Star.

Some things that are not used much might seem like nothing to some people, but they could be useful to others. The internet has helped people create online groups to make money by sharing these things. Websites and social media groups make it easy to buy and sell used items. This allows people to share things directly with each other. This is called the sharing economy.

In the 18th and 19th centuries, two main ideas about dreams became common. One idea was that dreams show things our minds don't usually think about. Freud thought that understanding our dreams could help us understand our hidden feelings and solve problems. However, another idea said that dreams are just random brain activity while the brain sorts through memories. When we wake up, we try to find meaning in these images and feelings and create a story.

I work for myself; I’m a freelancer. I like this because I choose my work and how I use my time. I started working at home, but it was difficult to focus. There were many distractions, like chores, drinks, and my family needing me. Then, I tried working at a café, but the internet wasn’t good, and I drank too much coffee. Finally, I rented a desk in a shared office with other freelancers. I enjoy getting ready for work and being able to concentrate in a quiet place.

NASA might be able to find smaller asteroids if they get enough money to build NEOCam. This is a space telescope that uses infrared light. It would help them find these asteroids. If they get the money, they could probably do this in ten years. Even then, the team protecting the Earth would still need to figure out how to stop the biggest and most dangerous asteroids – the PHAs.

A new idea called 'buy nothing' is popular online. People who normally suggest products to buy, like clothes and makeup, are now talking about it. Some YouTubers are telling their viewers not to buy anything for a whole year. Two friends in Canada tried this. They only bought food for one year. At first, they didn't buy electrical items, clothes, or things for their home. Then, they stopped paying for services like haircuts, meals at restaurants, or petrol for their cars. After a year, they saved $55,000.

Pi finds religion very important. Although his family is Hindu, he wants to learn about other religions too. He becomes friends with a Christian priest and a Muslim baker. Surprisingly, Pi says he is Hindu, Muslim and Christian at the same time. When his family and teachers ask him to choose one, he doesn’t want to. He says he just wants to love God. After that, his family and teachers allow him to decide what he believes.

Some people believe writing down your dreams can help you have lucid dreams. Lucid dreams are when you know you are dreaming and can control what happens. For example, you could change a bad dream into a good one, or guide your dream like a film director. This means you’re not just understanding your dreams, you’re creating them. It’s still a good idea to have some dreams where your mind can show you what it’s thinking about!

Many people don't know they are contributing to the problem of cheap clothing. They give their old clothes to charities. But charity shops cannot sell all of these clothes. Cheap, trendy clothes quickly go out of style and are often not good enough to recycle. People don't want to buy them used. A lot of clothes are thrown away. Charities send clothes they cannot sell to other countries. This causes more problems for those countries and harms the environment.

Some people like to have many exciting experiences. Meagan McGrath, from Canada, is one of these people. She has climbed the highest mountains in the world, cycled across Canada, and run a very long race in the Sahara Desert, where it was very hot. One of her most incredible trips was skiing to the South Pole. On her first day, she fell into a large block of ice and needed help. Many people would have stopped there, but Meagan continued. She reached the South Pole forty days later. She pulled a sled with her tent and food behind her through very cold weather and snowstorms.

Blek le Rat began by painting rats on walls in Paris. Now, he wants people to think about social problems. He paints pictures of people who don’t have homes, especially in large cities, to help people understand the problem of homelessness.

Some local governments are trying to help artists who want to paint on walls. They do this by letting them paint in special areas. For example, in Taiwan, there are 'graffiti zones' where artists can paint freely. In Brazil, the city of São Paulo has even allowed some artists to paint on the subway trains.

Faith47 lives in Cape Town, South Africa. She paints large, bright pictures of people and animals and enjoys discovering new places. You can see her art on streets, in old buildings and on old cars. She likes that street art doesn’t last forever and is often cleaned away. For Faith47, this shows that life is always changing, with things ending and new things starting.

Gabriela used to work in a place where people respected authority and followed instructions. Leaders made decisions, and people didn't question them. Now, her Swedish team is different. They like to work together with their bosses and share ideas. Their leaders help and encourage them to think for themselves.

Gabriela noticed that she and her team had different ways of doing things. She asked them to talk about how they felt about her leading the team. Her team was happy to share their thoughts. They said they weren’t used to being told exactly what to do. They liked to be able to take initiative and be creative. When Gabriela gave clear instructions, they felt she didn’t trust them to do a good job. They understood that Gabriela felt upset when they suggested changes to her decisions, and explained that this was their normal way of working.

Os Gêmeos are twin brothers from São Paulo. They paint things like small tags and big, colourful pictures of people on buildings. Their art is often very large, so they sometimes use cranes to help them. In 2007, they painted an entire castle in Scotland.

People have always liked to draw and write on walls. A long time ago, people in Africa and Europe painted animals and people on cave walls. We’ve also found writing on buildings in old places like Greece, Italy, Syria and Iraq. In the Roman town of Pompeii, experts found many examples of writing in Latin. These writings included messages about religion, politics, and love, and even some spells!

Have you ever thought about climbing Mount Everest or walking to the South Pole? Many people have this dream each year. They try to climb the highest mountains or walk across large areas of land. Explorers used to use maps and compasses, but now adventurers use modern tools like GPS and satellite phones. Some adventurers love nature and use their trips to talk about environmental problems. Others want to help people and collect money for charities.

The first thing is DART, which stands for the Double Asteroid Redirection Test. They plan to test DART near the moon of an asteroid called Didymos. Didymoon is about 150 meters wide and goes around Didymos, which is 800 meters wide. Scientists hope that when DART hits Didymoon, it will change its path a little bit so that telescopes on Earth can see it.

The story is about a sixteen-year-old girl named Katniss Everdeen. Her father died in an accident, so she needs to find food for her family. She and her friend Gale hunt in the forest near their home, and Katniss becomes good at using a bow and arrow. When her sister, Prim, is chosen for a contest, Katniss offers to take her place. Another boy from their area, Peeta, is also chosen. Katniss and Peeta soon develop a difficult relationship.

Writing about your dreams can help you remember them better. Think about the people and places in your dreams, as these details can be important. You’ll be surprised how much you can write down in a week. Then, you can start to see how your dreams relate to what happens and how you feel each day.

In the past, bridges were often made of wood, which made them easy to burn. This was a problem for bridges used by trains, because sparks from the wheels and tracks could start fires. These fires could destroy the whole bridge.

We don’t know how street art will change. But we are seeing some new things. Most street artists are young and they paint in their own town or area. However, many artists are now travelling and working in different countries. Some artists use the internet to communicate with each other and show their art. Also, people in the art world are starting to see street art as a real art form. We can’t know what the future holds, but street art will continue to exist!

Suzanne Collines has always felt sad when she watches news about wars. When she was a little girl, her father was a pilot in the US Air Force and he was in the war in Vietnam. Her mother tried to keep her from worrying by not telling her much about the war. But Suzanne still saw news reports and knew her dad was involved. It was a scary time for her.

PricewaterhouseCoopers (PwC) asked over 40,000 people, including many millennials (people born between 1983 and 1993), about their workplace. They wanted to know about things like the culture, how people communicate, pay, and work-life balance. Deloitte also asked over 10,000 millennials about their views on the challenges and chances in the world of work.

Erik Weihenmayer is a man from the United States who enjoys many adventures. He has cycled across deserts in Morocco, travelled by kayak through the Grand Canyon, and climbed Mount Everest. Erik has not been able to see since he was 13 years old. He wants to help people with disabilities to be active and takes groups of young blind people on climbing trips.

Online platforms are now making it easier for people to earn some money. For example, parents who used to not have time to sell their children’s old things at a market can now sell them online. With online marketplaces, parents can sell baby clothes that their children no longer wear and expensive strollers and baby equipment they don’t need anymore, so they can get some money back.

Pi and Richard Parker stay in a small boat for 227 days. They have problems with hunger, sickness, and tiredness. They face strong storms and very hot weather from the sun, but they manage to survive. Sometimes, Pi feels better when he thinks about his three religions, but other times he feels very lonely and sad. Finally, they see the Mexican coast. Things change then. It’s best not to spoil the ending, so you need to read the book to find out what happens to Pi and Richard Parker when they can see land.

Chloe got home from school and made coffee. She took it to her bedroom. She had homework, but she decided to wait. She wanted to enjoy the quiet time before her parents came home. Then the house would be noisy with talking, the TV, and her dad listening to jazz while he cooked dinner. Chloe liked this time because she could play with her pet rats.

In 2010, NASA’s team that protects Earth from space rocks found and recorded most of the asteroids that are close to Earth and are 1 kilometre wide. These asteroids are called 'near-Earth objects'. They are very big, like mountains, and are within 50 million kilometres of Earth's path around the sun. NASA still needs to find about 50 more. They say that none of the 887 they have found are likely to cause problems for Earth.

Auggie decided to go to school, but his first day was difficult. Like many children starting at a new school, he felt nervous. Because of how he looks, it was a very painful experience. No one wanted to sit with him, and he noticed other children looking at him and talking about him. Luckily, he made friends with Jack and Summer. But the school year wasn't easy. Auggie learned that some students were scared to touch him. He had many good and bad times during the year. Finally, a surprising and upsetting event at a school trip changed everything.

The two men looked towards the north side of the land. It went on and on, as far as they could see. Even the fences were hard to see from where they were. No matter how bored or disobedient a young boy felt, he couldn’t run away. Sam watched the largest horse, which stamped its big feet on the ground. Could the boy ride it? he thought. A good rider could cause a lot of problems out here, so far from anyone. But perhaps someone who didn't know anything about horses would have even bigger problems, trying to leave his father.

More than 4,000 people, between the ages of 13 and 80, have climbed to the top of Mount Everest. Climbing very high mountains in cold weather and strong storms is still very risky, but the best climbers now want new challenges. Gerlinde Kaltenbrunner from Austria started to enjoy mountain climbing when she was a teenager. After she finished school, she worked as a nurse, but she also continued to climb mountains in her spare time.

After climbing Mount Everest, Gerlinde wanted to climb all fourteen of the world’s mountains that are over 8,000 metres high. To make it more difficult, she climbs without using oxygen. This is dangerous because the lack of oxygen at the top of tall mountains can harm your brain and body. Gerlinde uses her popularity as a climber to help a charity that supports children and orphans in Nepal.

Think about the things we’ve bought. We can probably see that we don’t use everything we own. For example, maybe we have a warm coat even though we live in a hot country. Or perhaps we have an old phone that we don’t use anymore because we bought a newer one. Sometimes we buy things like cars that we only use occasionally, or even turn a spare room into a storage space.

People have believed for a long time that dreams can predict the future. They thought dreams were important messages, giving us information or understanding. Many people remember dreaming about something, like a place or person, and then it actually happened later.

Many large and costly construction projects around the world involve building bridges. Bridges are important connections that allow cars, trucks, and trains to travel across water, mountains, or other roads. Because of their importance, bridges are a key part of civil engineering and are carefully checked, particularly if they fail.

Gabriela was having problems with her team, so she wrote an email to her manager from Sweden. The manager asked if she thought her team was working well and what she needed to work better with them. Gabriela felt her manager wasn't being clear and didn't think he was helping enough.

Dogs that live together have learned that people are more likely to give food to smaller, more attractive dogs. So, these dogs go to beg for food for the whole group. Some dogs have even learned to use the city’s train system to travel around their area! Scientists don’t know how the dogs know when to get off the train. They think the dogs might use their good sense of smell to find places they like. Or, they might learn to understand the names of the train stops. Either way, people who use the trains are now used to seeing dogs and they usually don’t notice them.

Ed Stafford, from the UK, was the first person to walk the whole way along the Amazon River. He began near a small river in the Andes mountains of Peru. He finished at the river's end in Brazil, after two years and four months. He walked 6,000 kilometers. The Amazon rainforest has dangerous animals like poisonous snakes, crocodiles, and jaguars, so Ed was often in danger. He was very lucky to survive, and he only suffered from many mosquito and ant bites.

In the UK, people spend over £1,000 on new clothes each year. This is about 4% of what they earn. It may not seem like a lot, but there are some problems with this. Many people use credit cards to buy clothes. People in the UK owe about £670 to credit card companies, which is almost the money they spend on clothes. People are spending money they don't have, and buying things they don't really need. The UK throws away 300,000 tons of clothes every year, and most of it ends up in landfills.

Ed couldn’t have walked without technology. He used a radio to ask people in the rainforest for food and to ask if he could cross their land. Many people came to see him and helped him walk through the hardest parts of the land. While he was walking, Ed wrote a blog about what he did each day. He used the news about his trip to talk about the damage to the rainforest and to collect money for groups that help the environment and children in Brazil and Peru.

Many businesses now see that the sharing economy can make them money, and they want to use things that are not being used much. A common business idea is for companies to create websites that connect people who need something with people who can provide it. For example, Airbnb helps people rent out rooms or houses they don’t need all the time to make money. Uber is another example; it lets people use their own cars to give rides and earn extra money.

Zoos today are very important for helping endangered animals. Sometimes, rare animals in the wild have trouble finding partners and having babies. They can also be in danger from people hunting them, losing their homes, or being attacked by other animals. Good zoos give these animals a safe place to live and breed. Also, when the number of wild animals decreases, they can become too alike. Breeding programmes help with this: animals born in zoos can be released into the wild to make the animal population more varied.

These accidents are very uncommon. Trains and boats can both damage bridges, but in different ways. Trains can damage a bridge because of how fast they are going. Boats can damage a bridge because they are very heavy, even if they are moving slowly. To prevent bridge damage, it is important to plan ahead. New technologies that find problems with the bridge's structure, safer work conditions, and improved designs can all help reduce these accidents.

Pi was scared of the animals and jumped into the sea. Then he remembered there were sharks in the water and had to climb back into the lifeboat. The animals in the lifeboat started to kill and eat each other until only Pi and a tiger were left. Luckily, the tiger, who Pi called Richard Parker, felt sick and didn’t want to eat him.

When Pi is sixteen years old, a new government is chosen that his parents disagree with. They are worried about what will happen, so Pi’s parents decide to close the zoo and move to Canada. They sell some of the animals to other zoos in North America. The family travels to Canada by ship, taking some of the animals with them. During the journey, there is a very bad storm and the ship sinks. Sadly, Pi’s family and the sailors all die, but Pi survives and is in a small boat with a hyena, zebra, orangutan and a large tiger.

The Hunger Games is a very popular book for teenagers and young people, written by the American Suzanne Collins. It was published in 2008 and has been translated into many languages. It has sold millions of copies worldwide. It was also the first book for children to sell over a million copies online. Now, it’s a big film and is very successful too. It earned a lot of money, over 150 million dollars, in its first weekend in North America.

Dreams might happen because our brains try to sort out our thoughts from the day. But in dreams, these thoughts often have a special meaning. When we are awake, we usually think in words, like we are talking to ourselves. But when we sleep, the part of our brain that uses language is less busy, while the part that controls feelings becomes more active.

Being happy often means having good relationships with others. A study showed that people who are happy usually have close relationships with their friends and family, and they spend time with them often. It’s also important to have at least one person you can talk to about your feelings – this is called 'sharing'. Just one close friend is enough, along with other friends too. It's not enough to just have friends to do things with or talk about hobbies. A stronger, more personal connection is very important. Sometimes, people need to learn how to listen better to build better relationships.

Psychologist Carol Dweck believes our brains can change and we can learn new skills, even if we weren’t good at them before. Often, we praise people for their results or what seems like natural talent, for example, saying ‘You’re good at noticing details’ or ‘You're good at planning events’. But studies show that praising effort, trying new things, and how people solve problems can help them learn new skills and improve existing ones.

The rover checks the air around it regularly. In 2014, it found methane in the air. Methane is a simple organic molecule and a key part of natural gas. It doesn’t last long – only a few hundred years. This means something on Mars is creating more methane. NASA says Mars releases a lot of methane – thousands of tons at once. The amount of methane changes with the seasons, almost like the planet is breathing.

Carol Dweck, a psychologist from Stanford University, gave difficult problems to a group of ten-year-old children. Some children liked the challenge and believed they could get better. Carol Dweck called this a ‘growth mindset’ – thinking about what they could do. Other children felt they had failed and thought their intelligence wasn't good enough. This is called a ‘fixed mindset’ – finding it hard to improve. Some of these children said they might cheat, and others tried to feel better by comparing themselves to those who were doing worse.

Horror films often use places where nobody lives. This could be an old, empty hospital, a frightening house, or a town with no people. These lonely places make us wonder – what was it like when people lived there? Why did they go? It’s also scary because they are so quiet. It’s easy for film directors to use these places too, because it seems believable that you wouldn't have a phone signal there.

In scary movies, basements are often frightening places. They are usually dark and damp, and you reach them by a small staircase. Sometimes, something is hiding there, or a bad person might have hidden things. Basements can feel creepy even when nothing is actually there.

Gary Collins was a policeman who wasn't working when he watched the riots in London on TV. He knew some of the people involved, so he stopped his holiday to help find them. He spent six months looking at CCTV videos and identified 190 people, often just by looking at their eyes. His help was very important for the police investigation. Even with special computer programs, the police only found one person from 200,000 hours of video.

I find it really interesting to think about how we can make our bodies develop faster. What if we could put a computer in our brain? Soon, we might be able to do this and improve things like our ability to do math, see and hear better, and remember things more easily. I think this will become more common in the future.

The talk was very interesting, and the speaker was right about some things. For example, parents influence their children. It's hard to stop teenagers from texting while doing homework when they see their parents using social media while cooking or waiting in the car. She also said that people often want to do many things at the same time. So, they talk to people in person and online. I see this a lot with my daughter and her friends. They plan to meet, but then they sit together and talk on their phones instead.

Some news makes us think the world is more violent, but there’s also reason to be hopeful. From the end of World War II until 1990, there were many wars that killed a lot of people. Now, countries are generally living more peacefully than before, even though there are still wars. However, terrorism has increased recently, and wars have killed more people who are not soldiers. But, the situation isn’t completely negative. People are more likely to die from crime than from wars. Also, the number of murders worldwide has decreased slightly, from 8 people per 100,000 in 2000 to about 5.3 in 2015.

Wasfia has spent her life helping people’s rights. She has seen many projects to help women and girls in Bangladesh. However, these projects often stop, and the women are left with nothing. Wasfia thought Bangladesh needed to do more to support itself. So, she combined her love of climbing mountains with her work for human rights to try and change how people think about women. She started climbing when she worked on projects in Tibet and Nepal. This is because Bangladesh is mostly flat and people rarely see mountains. Her campaign is getting attention from people in Bangladesh and around the world.

Many people think that developing countries are in a bad situation: with lots of poverty, ruled by dictators, and with not much hope for improvement. But this is not completely true. Things are actually changing. In the last 20 years, more than 700 million people have earned more money and escaped poverty. Also, 6 million fewer children die each year because of sickness. More girls are going to school, and millions of people now have clean water.

Many managers try to make feedback more positive by putting negative comments between good ones. But, if this happens often, employees might think the positive comments are just to hide the negative ones, and they won't be as helpful. Instead, positive feedback should encourage good work, not just soften criticism.

I support the Campaign to Stop Killer Robots. Don’t think of scary robots from movies. Instead, think about what’s happening now. Military machines like drones and robots are already being used to kill, with not much help from people. Soon, there might be robots that can make their own decisions about who to kill. I believe this would be wrong and dangerous for everyone. We need to be careful about what we tell machines to do.

More people learn English than learn any other language. English is also spoken in many countries. However, more people speak Chinese as their first language than speak any other language. The number of people who speak a language as their first language doesn't seem to be connected to how many people learn it. But there is a connection between how many people learn a language and how many countries where it’s spoken.

Your manager wants to talk to you about your work on the recent project. You feel worried about this all weekend, thinking about what you might have done wrong. On Monday morning, you go to her office. She starts by saying you did a good job, and you wonder if she's just being polite before giving you criticism. You know that sometimes people give compliments first, then tell you what you need to improve, and then give another compliment.

Born in the USA is a lively and energetic rock album. However, the songs also have strong feelings. The music is catchy, but it tells stories about difficult times for some people in America. Many songs are about people who work hard but don’t have a good life. They feel sad and angry. For example, Glory Days is about people remembering when they were young and had hope. The song Downbound Train tells a story about a young man who loses his job and his life becomes difficult. It seems the singer is writing about real people and how things could have been different. This album shows you how talented the singer is.

Lewis wants more areas of the ocean to be protected. He thinks this could help fix problems caused by people, like overfishing and pollution. Lewis has seen these problems himself. He has seen coral reefs that have lost their color because the water is too warm. He has also seen areas under the sea where there are no plants or animals, and lots of plastic. Lewis believes nature can get better if we let it. But we need to act quickly. If we don’t take care of the oceans, we might have a very big problem that we can’t fix.

Terrie Sharp is a very popular writer of crime stories. She has won an important award twice. She grew up in a neighborhood with a lot of crime in Glasgow. She learned to be quiet and avoid problems. She even learned how to open car doors with a knife. Luckily, she only uses this knowledge for her stories. Now, she talks a lot, appearing on TV shows like Police Today and at writing events all over the UK.

Do things seem to be getting worse? Is it impossible to make progress? In Enlightenment Now, Steven Pinker looks at how humans have progressed and finds positive results. We are living longer, healthier, more free, and happier lives. Pinker believes the problem is that the ideas of reason and science are now being challenged. When people talk in ways that encourage division, hopelessness, and a lack of trust, it can harm important things like democracy and working together around the world.

In old horror movies, it was hard for characters to get help because they couldn’t call for help or the police. Now, with cell phones, this is less believable. To keep the suspense, writers make sure there’s no cell phone signal! If you’re a hero in a scary movie, you probably won’t have any signal when you really need to call for help. Or your phone battery will run out just as you’re making the call. Sometimes, both things happen.

In the 1950s, companies that grew bananas for business in Central America had a problem. Their most profitable banana, called Gros Michel (or Big Mike), was dying. Now, the same thing is happening to Cavendish, which replaced Big Mike. Gros Michel bananas were easy to transport, had thick skins, and tasted good. They grew everywhere in Central America. United Fruit Company, the biggest grower and exporter at the time, grew bananas very efficiently. They didn’t grow new plants from seeds. Instead, they took shoots from existing plants and grew them close together in fields.

Most spiders have venom. They use it to catch food, not to attack people. Only a few types of spiders have venom that can seriously hurt humans. Spider bites can be painful, but they are usually not life-threatening. The Sydney funnel-web spider in Australia hasn't killed anyone since we created an antidote in 1981. Be careful not to upset hairy spiders like tarantulas. If they feel scared, they will spray irritating hairs that can get into your skin or eyes.

This common idea was liked in many horror movies from the late 1900s. The movie starts with a group of young people having fun, but it ends with almost everyone dying except one girl. At the beginning, this girl is often quiet, nervous, and not very brave. But by the end, she becomes the strongest and most clever person. The last girl usually survives.

To understand how humans developed the ability to use complicated language, we need to study what makes our brains different from those of other animals. It’s not just about brain size; we also need to consider what other abilities our brains have and how these abilities developed over time. Unfortunately, there's not much physical evidence to help us; ancient tools don’t tell us what kind of speech our ancestors could produce. However, we can see changes in the mouths, throats, and tongues of early humans. Around 100,000 years ago, humans started to be able to make more complicated sounds. Before that time, scientists can only make guesses about whether early humans communicated with simpler sounds.

People, not nature, decide that girls should like art and languages, and boys should do maths and science. It’s also difficult to find good examples of women working in science. In cartoons and stories, scientists and inventors are often men. Some people think scientists are strange, don’t have good social skills, or work alone. These ideas are not always true, but they might make girls not want to be scientists. If girls saw more women in science, they might feel more confident and like they belong.

The Scallion is a newspaper that comes out once a week. It’s free and you can find it in buildings at the university. About 10,000 students read it. Students write and make the newspaper themselves. A survey shows that students and teachers like the newspaper for fun, to learn about culture, and to get work experience. It costs a lot of money to print the newspapers. Also, some students find it difficult to get a copy because they have to go to the university in person. Finally, many copies are thrown away and become litter on campus.

At Girox Foods, about 12% of our employees leave each year. This is higher than average for our industry, which is around 7%. This report will look at why employees are not fully involved in their work and suggest ways to make the workplace better and keep employees longer.

Much of what the speaker said seemed correct. I think there’s a risk that the more we connect online, the more lonely we feel. I don’t think this is a big problem for my generation, because we grew up without technology. We know how to be alone and we know it’s okay. But young people, who are under 20, are different. They are always communicating online, so they don’t feel quiet time. They might not learn to enjoy being by themselves. Also, they learn to talk by sending messages that can be changed. This means they don’t learn how to have real conversations with people face to face.

It’s not always good to follow positive comments with negative ones. If you always give positive and negative feedback together, the positive comments might seem less important and people might stop listening. Try to give positive comments sometimes just because they are positive, and don't always add improvements or criticisms.
